A rash has formed across my chest
My breath arrested when I reach my rusty car
To find the window shattered
Backseat full of broken glassPanting to surprised to ask
Hands on hips I shake my headAnd catch a glimpse of white and red
On my windscreen

I look to see and find a fine
For parking slightly over time
Without a permit on a street
That's barely on the map.

Standing frozen in the sun
My whole day's work has been undone
By some smarmy, smirking, hard-work-shirking
Member of Victoria's biggest scam
They don't serve and protect
They steal and neglect!

Get in, key in ignition, engine won't spin, try again,
Give some gas, swear and plead and mutter,
The motor starts to splutter
It works at least for now

It's a piece of junk, I know,
But it gets from A to B, although
A is nowhere
and B could be the moon
for all the progress made

Like running on a treadmill
With my head against the wall --
Please don't stall!
I need to get back home
To my beer and my sports
And my chair on my porch
Where I can be safe and secure, and alone.

Stuck in traffic, can't relax
Aching back, knuckles crack
rash is spreading
Orange light, play it safe
I can't stop there's some idiot on my tail
So I sail through the lights
And smile for the CASH camera.

"You just lost another demerit point, what do you have to say for yourself?"

It wasn't my fault!

"Shut up! You're a criminal, a hoon,
And we'll stop you -- clock you, fine you,
Serve you a notice, send you to court,
send you to jail, abuse you, assess you,
release you, harrass you, provoke you,
And act in self defence --
Before someone gets hurt.

Cassidy the sundance kid
Bowed out with a merry jig
Hollow-point bullets gave police an excuse
To shoot him five times over

But that's not fair!

"Shut up! 3000 police: no warning, no excuses
Here: drink more beer!
If you drink and drive you're a bloody idiot
Buy more stuff; pay more tax
Work longer hours; learn to relax
We're here to help; no fixed address?
We can track you down on Facebook.

I tried to beat the traffic
But the traffic always wins
When the level crossing rings
Like a muazin's incessant call
To crowds who gather at the wall

A procession of suburban trains
Accompanied by freight
As we sit, and sweat, and wait.

Had to turn the engine off;
Been running very, very low;
Car is like an oven
And desert winds now blow
As I lean out the window what do I see?

A smarmy, smirking, hard-work-shirking
Robbing copper writing out a ticket
He turns and gives me a familiar look
As he scribbles in his nasty book
That says he loves to make us pay
I'll bet the highlight of his day


I try to take a calming breath
But fumes have filled the air
I try to picture happy scenes
But can't block out the blare of the traffic
Or the glare of the sun
In the heat of the moment
My innards are coiled
My blood starts to boil and spatter
I'm so pissed off I could shatter!
And tears of frustration threaten to stream
My bile is rising fed by a scream
That prises my maw and grinds down my jaw
A titanic, volcanic eruption explodes
With fire and brimstone and sulphurous snows

And suddenly
The air grows cool
The wind dies down
The sun is dimmed
The noise recedes
The blood drains from my face
I let you take my place

I have something just in reach
That I know would shut them up
It always sings so sweetly
When in traffic I am stuck

I have something just in reach
That I know would make them still
All I want is silence
After one last blasting thrill

I have something just in reach
It's song's so sweet today
All I have to do is grab it
And I can make them pay

Should I use it?
Should I?
I should, don't you agree?
Wouldn't you if you were here?
You wouldn't?
So I see...

Bang.

entry.title: Package to 3442
entry.content:
Dear N,

I hope all is well.
There's so much to tell;
But nothing to say,
Since I went my own way.

Herein you shall find a stick with a chip,
With thousands of floating gate transistors,
Formatted to standard NTFS,
Although by me EXT4 would be
A better file system, more secure;
With in-built journalling for recovery
Of photos of us on a sunny day,
And clips of us kissing all morning in bed;
And line after line of raw sentiments,
Before they were compiled and found to have
Undeclared variables and hidden flaws,
Which failed under the unforeseen stress
Of our legacy run-time environment,
And the drain on our modest resources
Of startup tasks that we never asked for.

I wonder sometimes, during shutdown, whether
Our pre-releases could have been better;
If we had tested a little harder,
Could we have cleaned up the code a bit more?
But I think our source code was not too bad,
As it was, with all its faults and extra loops:
We could have corrected them in due course,
If our framework had been more workable;
If she had not been overclocked for nine months,
If the damn doctors had safely removed
That unstable, hungry, internal device,
Which should have long before been unmounted,
But for the Pentecostal clamouring
That the Church has an M$-like patent
On who gets to live, and who gets to die,
And whose family gets to be ruined.

If only good advice had been followed
Early on in your project's life cycle,
Which, I admit, started underfunded,
But got so much funding from its victory,
Fought long and hard for, we would all agree,
That you could have outsourced all your grunt work,
And spent one-hundred-percent of your time
On the twenty-percent that you deserved;
Instead, you kept the QA to yourself
And stuck your ambitions on the high shelf,
And waited for your comfortable bubble
To burst one day and spatter everywhere,
Painting the picture in its true colours.

But I knew none of that on our first chat;
And if I'd known then what I have since learned,
I think I still would have signed that contract,
Because in hindsight you are still beautiful,
As you are, with all your funny drivers,
And occasional, forgivable segfaults.

If we had been completely open source,
And reported bugs boldly, without fear,
I might not have felt compelled to fork from you.
Because, in truth, messy code's not so bad,
If the ideas behind it have merit,
And the devs can agree on the language.

And one day, just maybe, I dream sometimes,
We could take more photos on sunny days,
And make many more silly mini-films
In bad lighting, with a cheap, on-board mic,
And upload them to an online album,
Where they'd stay afloat, all day, in the cloud,
While on the ground, we'd grow our own small LAN,
Just a couple squeaky Puppy lappies,
And then a server and a MythTV,
Then we'd have our very own LAN party,
And before long , we'd build our own distribution --
Ubuntu-based, filled with Python and PERL --
It would be stable, resilient,
Configurable and fun to improve.
And we wouldn't worry about precise input,
Because our command line would be tolerant.

And I?
Well, I would be more forgiving.

All the best;
You know the rest.

entry.title: Echoing Dream
entry.content:
The sun does arise,
And brighten mine eyes;
Merry thoughts ring,
As I touch your rough skin.
I give you a nudge,
But you, heavy, won't budge.
I won't make a sound;
You my arms wrap around.
And my darling, you seem
My echoing dream.

You tangled my hair;
I laughed away care.
Your smooth pate I stroke:
Ah, now you've awoke.
So to start each new day
Has us often both say,
"Such such was the joy
Of which both, girl and boy,
In our youth time would dream
When we played on the green."
        
And our little ones, merry,
Will make us both weary,
But the sun shall descend;
Day shall come to an end.
In the arms of each other,
We, the father and mother,
Like children at rest,
Will begin our sweet jest.
And my love, you my dream,
Shall every night seem.

entry.title: Working Habits
entry.content:
I like to work in the dark alone,
With the door shut very tight,
And the shutters on the windows
Not permitting any light.

It helps me drift into my work,
And forget that just out there
Is a world of sound and music,
Conversation and fresh air.

So I sink into my desk chair,
And tap and click and slouch;
When the sun has long since set,
I'll retire to my couch,

And stare at people in the act
Of doing what I might,
If I never had to pay my bills,
If I'd had the strength to fight.

entry.title: Fire and Ice
entry.content:
Blue eyes seek out hazel
Red lips beckon pink
Whirlpool whispers electric hands
Ice and fiery drink

White of eyes wide open
Black of hair unfurled
Fingers playing hide and seek
In unleashed coiling curls

Hand to hand to purring blues
Lead and follow interchanged
Liquid, swaying, swirling moves
Hands and hips are chained

Long red nails' slow ascent
From arm to chest to throat
Black hair snakes across the bridge
Above a steaming moat

War drums beating in a chest
Sounding the advance
Of blood red lips and glistening teeth
In a mesmerising dance

Behind the wall a civil war
A clash of lust and fear
One is strong, one intense
Red lips almost here!

Hazel eyes stand their ground
Pink lips shut the gates
Body quivers with desire
Until the lust abates

Blue eyes freeze and harden
Expand and then contract
Black hair slithers in retreat
Long red nails retract

In the sudden arctic air
Perfume forms a cloud
Long black hair and longer legs
Melt into the crowd

Pink lips breathe a drawn out sigh
Eyelids start to sink
The night is drawing to a close
Time for one last drink

The cloud soon breaks
But a heart still waits
For brown eyes soft and kind
That live in the mind
Even after soft brown eyes
Have learned the hazel to despise

Location : 22 Gerald St, Murrumbeena VIC 3163,

entry.title: Huntsman At The Window
entry.content:
A huntsman at my window came to greet me,
But I preferred to let him sit outside;
The huntsman is an absent-minded spider,
Dreaming, I suppose, of catching flies.

I stared at him and even deigned a smile,
But he just froze and tried to stare away;
It's hard for him not to be circumspect;
All the more he shouldn't lose his way.

But that's the huntsman, like a little child;
Drifting in and out to say hello;
My visitor who's welcome from a distance;
My guest who'd best learn when it's time to go.

entry.title: You Want To Be Heard
entry.content:
You want to be heard, 
But you haven't the words
You're big and strong but silent
When you open your mouth
The shout and cheer
But never listen -- listen!
Something's missing
With blunt verbs in your quiver
You try to deliver your message
But it drops like a stone
The words you assemble tell them
All they think they need to know
And then you're find you're alone
In a queue waiting your turn
To plead with a drone on the phone
For a little compassion
But the only reaction you get
Is a bundle of anesthetic phrases
And here's the translation:

We don't care
Not a whit not a hair
If you have to take a hit
So have a nice day
And don't forget to pay
This call is over, stop wasting your time
As you sigh your well worn sigh
You hear the faint echo of
Inflated wallets
In bulging pockets
Flapping like laughing hyenas

You, you have no words that you have grown
You scoop yours from the FM blather
That scums the surface of your brain
As trundle home on the freeway
Or the freeze-dried music
In someone else's ears
In the crush of a rush-hour train
When you collapse on your couch
Unadulterated, unfettered thoughts break the surface
So you drown them with another helping
Of processed, dehydrated, microwave-oven television
Shipped in, in neat little packages,  across the Pacific
From our adopted Big Brother,
Where everything is bigger, stronger, louder, shinier, richer,
lonelier, poorer, angrier, and emptier too.

You, you don't own your words
You rent them
And pay more and more for fewer and less
When you try to express what's on your chest
Your expressions are eviscerated
Your phrases are amputated
Your feelings are decapitated
They writhe inside, unwilling to die, unable to stop
No-one can know them
No-one can see them
No way of taking someone by the hand
And showing the dark clouds that gather
Instead you take people by the throat
And unleash your thunder and lightning

It feels good to be Thor, doesn't it?
It makes you feel raw
Make you feel alive
With your hammer of a hand 
That can land with a crash and a bang
When they fall you stand tall
You're someone, not a no-one
You're big and loud and strong

But how does it feel to hold pictures
And have letters slip through your fingers?
To work hard to get ahead
And have words fly over your head?
To take pride in the fact that
You can read looks
And be reminded sometimes that
You can't read books?
Except to absorb with ears tone-deaf and numb to
Their discordant inferences
And parasitic untruths
That worm themselves into your brain?

So you, yes you, you can blame and complain
But do you want to change?
Or will you stay the same?
Restricted to your range
Defined by your age
Classed by your sex
Believing in myths
Despising the truth
Accepting dishonesty
Preaching misanthropy
While your curiosity atrophies
And your bitterness spreads to your bones?

But don't take my word for it, big man,
You need to grow up and go find your own.

entry.title: Little Lamb
entry.content:
I had a little hungry lamb;
to feed it was no chore --
it drank its milk with such delight!,
and grazed from dawn till noon till night.
Although it never lived in want,
it always asked for more.

I never could deny my lamb,
I wished for it to grow
I couldn't bear to have my pet
Give me any cause to fret
If I could block the slightest pain
I had to make it so.

In my dreams I met its soul;
it seemed to grow each night.
And every morning would me greet
a smaller lamb beside my feet.
And though it never seemed afraid,
I think it always knew.

But when it fit inside my hand
and made its home my bedside stand,
I bade "goodnight" and then "goodbye"
and went to get some rest.
As I drifted off to sleep,
it sank into my chest.

I have a hungry little lamb;
I try to feed it all I can:
I kiss and cuddle with delight,
and stroke and hug and purr all night.
Every morning glad I see
it always asks for more.
